title: Does my blog design really matter? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends. Is it a brand new site just getting started and not for an already existing business? And you don’t have any audience that you’re bringing with you? Then I argue that no, your design doesn’t matter much yet, because no one is reading your content! I usually tell new creators to focus on creating content (and therefore getting it indexed by search engines… age of content is currently a big part of being seen as an authority). Once you’ve got a good base of 20 or so articles that you’re proud of, you can focus on getting your design exactly how you want it. At minimum, just make sure your design is mobile friendly and doesn’t have any horrible, glaring errors (like almost-white text on a white background). Other than that, worry about how it looks once there are actually people looking at it! I explain more in #5 here. Good luck!

Yes, of course it does. No matter how good your content is, if a reader comes to your blog and can’t easily find what they’re looking for, they’ll leave. Think of any time you’ve gone to a store and found messy, cluttered aisles, unhelpful staff, and long lines. You left, right? Or just felt really frustrated shopping there? It’s the same with your blog. Your blog design matters.
